statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -3 \\ -18 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 48 \\ 30 \\ 66 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] span or don't span \mathbb{R}^4.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -2 \\ -3 \\ 1 \\ -4 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -5 \\ -4 \\ -5 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -9 \\ -3 \\ -18 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 48 \\ 30 \\ 66 \\ -12 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 3 \\ 1 \\ 4 \\ -2 \end{array}\right] do not span \mathbb{R}^4.
